Release Date: Issue 14 (April 7)
As we approach the 100th anniversary of the attempt at secession, a notable surge of
public interest in the war between the states is in evidence. The purpose of this
series is to give a report on the major battles of that war as seen by a specific
Michigan regiment. In the series the South is treated sympathetically; nevertheless,
the primary point of view is Northern, and the focus of attention is placed on
Northern troops.
The material for the series is taken directly from official records, regimental
histories and Adjutant Generalâ€™s reports. The consultant is E. E. Barthell, author
of the Civil War section in the Encyclopedia Britannica.
Although great stress is placed on the role of Michigan troops, it was felt that
the series would be of general interest in many other areas of the country. Nowhere
is the impression given that Michigan won the war without assistance.
